New Records: Edson Álvarez scored a 101st-minute goal to secure Mexico's comeback victory
Key Match Events: Mexico won a penalty shootout after the match ended 2-2 in extra time
Edson Álvarez converted a retake after a controversial save by the Honduran goalkeeper
Mexico qualified for the 2024 Copa América
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico was on the brink of elimination and needed a comeback to avoid being eliminated from the Nations League
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was a significant achievement for Mexico in international football
CONCACAF executives and fans celebrated the thrilling comeback
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was marked by controversy over stoppage time and the penalty shootout
Mexico's ability to come back from a 2-1 deficit showcased their resilience
